Package edu.uky.cs.nil.sabre

Class Exceptions

java.lang.Object
edu.uky.cs.nil.sabre.Exceptions
public class Exceptions extends Object
All exceptions are generated from this utility class so that exception messages can be kept in one place for easy comparison and modification.
Author:
Stephen G. Ware

    cannotAssign(Fluent fluent, Expression value)

    • indexOutOfBounds

      public static final IndexOutOfBoundsException indexOutOfBounds(int index)
      Thrown any time an index in a list, array, etc. is accessed which does not exist.
      Parameters:
      index - the index
      Returns:
      an IndexOutOfBoundsException

    • iteratorOutOfElements

      public static final NoSuchElementException iteratorOutOfElements()
      Thrown any time Iterator.next() is called on an Iterator that has no more elements.
      Returns:
      a NoSuchElementException

    • uniqueHashCodesNotNegative

      public static final IllegalArgumentException uniqueHashCodesNotNegative(Unique unique)
      Thrown when a unique object's hash code returns a negative number.
      Parameters:
      unique - the unique object with a negative hash code
      Returns:
      an IllegalArgumentException

      Thrown when a memory budget fails to parse a string expressing an amount of memory.

      Returns:
      an IllegalArgumentException

    • memoryBudgetExceeded

      public static final OutOfMemoryError memoryBudgetExceeded(long size)
      Thrown when a memory budget is asked to allocate memory despite having 0 bytes left.
      Parameters:
      size - the full size of the original memory budget
      Returns:
      an OutOfMemoryError

      Thrown when a logical formula should be ground (that is, should contain no variables) but is not.
      Parameters:
      logical - a logical formula which is not ground
      Returns:
      a FormatException

      type - the type it should not be

    • cannotConvertToEffect

      public static final FormatException cannotConvertToEffect(Expression expression)
      Thrown when converting a logical expression to an effect which cannot be converted to an effect.
      Parameters:
      expression - the expression which cannot be converted to an effect
      Returns:
      a FormatException

    • variableMayNotBeNumeric

      public static final FormatException variableMayNotBeNumeric()
      Thrown when a variable that is explicitly or implicitly quantified is of type number, which is not allowed, since there are infinitely many numbers.
      Returns:
      a FormatException

    • cannotAssign

      public static final FormatException cannotAssign(Fluent fluent, Expression value)
      Thrown when a logical expression would assign a value to a fluent but the fluent's type does not allow it to have that value.
      Parameters:
      fluent - the fluent being assigned
      value - the value which is the wrong type to be assigned to the fluent
      Returns:
      a FormatException

    • conditionBranchCount

      public static final FormatException conditionBranchCount(int conditions, int branches)
      Thrown when a conditional logical expression has a mismatch between the number of conditions and branches (the number of branches must always be exactly 1 more than the number of conditions).
      Parameters:
      conditions - the number of conditions given to the conditional
      branches - the number of branches given to the conditional
      Returns:
      a FormatException

    • cannotIsolate

      public static final FormatException cannotIsolate(Expression query, Expression expression)
      Thrown when a query (usually a fluent) cannot be isolated by itself on the left side of a comparison by applying simple transformations to the comparison.
      Parameters:
      query - the expression that cannot be isolated
      expression - the expression in which the query occurs
      Returns:
      a FormatException

    • effectConditionCannotBeFalse

      public static final FormatException effectConditionCannotBeFalse()
      Thrown when an effect is created with false as its condition.
      Returns:
      a FormatException

    • substitutionCount

      public static final IllegalArgumentException substitutionCount(int originals, int replacements)
      Thrown when the number of original objects in a substitution does not match the number of replacement objects.
      Parameters:
      originals - the number of original objects
      replacements - the number of replacement objects
      Returns:
      an IllegalArgumentException

    • notDefined

      public static final FormatException notDefined(String type, String name)
      Thrown when some object of a given type and (optionally) with a given name should be defined, but no objects of that type with that name are defined. Example situations include requesting a type that does not exist from a universe or when an object should be defined in a list of definitions but is not.
      Parameters:
      type - the type of thing that should be defined
      name - the name of the thing, or null if the name is not relevant
      Returns:
      a FormatException

    • typeMayNotBeExtended

      public static final FormatException typeMayNotBeExtended(Type type)
      Thrown when trying to create a subtype of a type which cannot have any subtypes. For example, the type boolean cannot have any subtypes.
      Parameters:
      type - the name of the type which cannot have any subtypes
      Returns:
      a FormatException

    • typeMayNotExtend

      public static final FormatException typeMayNotExtend(Type type)
      Thrown when trying to make a type which cannot have any supertypes a supertype of some other type. For example, the type boolean may not have any supertypes.
      Parameters:
      type - the name of the type which may not have any supertypes
      Returns:
      a FormatException

    • typeCycle

      public static final FormatException typeCycle(Type child, Type parent)
      Thrown when a cycle has been created in a universe's type ontology.
      Parameters:
      child - the child type of the relationship which created the cycle
      parent - the parent type of the relationship which created the cycle
      Returns:
      a FormatException

    • notANumber

      public static final IllegalArgumentException notANumber(Number value)
      Thrown when a Java number cannot be converted to a numeric value.
      Parameters:
      value - the Java number which cannot be converted
      Returns:
      an IllegalArgumentException

    • divideByZero

      public static final ArithmeticException divideByZero(Expression numerator)
      Thrown when evaluating a logical expression (usually an arithmetic expression) would cause division by zero.
      Parameters:
      numerator - the number that would be divided by zero
      Returns:
      an ArithmeticException

    • entityMayNotBeOfType

      public static final FormatException entityMayNotBeOfType(Entity entity, Type type)
      Thrown when attempting to assign an entity a type which it cannot have. Entities cannot be of type boolean or number.
      Parameters:
      entity - the entity
      type - a type the entity may not have
      Returns:
      a FormatException

    • infiniteValues

      public static final FormatException infiniteValues()
      Thrown when requesting a list of all values of type number, which is infinitely many values.
      Returns:
      a FormatException

    • parameterMayNotBeNull

      public static final FormatException parameterMayNotBeNull(int index)
      Thrown when defining a parameter (usually in a signature) to be the value unknown.
      Parameters:
      index - the index of the parameter
      Returns:
      a FormatException

    • makesAmbiguous

      public static final FormatException makesAmbiguous(String type, Signature definition, Signature ambiguous)
      Thrown when defining a new thing would make a previously defined thing ambiguous. This usually happens when a fluent or event template implicitly defines something which was already implicitly defined by another fluent or event template.
      Parameters:
      type - the type of thing being ambiguously defined
      definition - the name or definition of the thing being ambiguously defined
      ambiguous - the already defined thing which is not being redefined
      Returns:
      a FormatException

    • illegalEffect

      public static final FormatException illegalEffect(Expression expression)
      Thrown when an effect is a contradiction, such as when a fluent is assigned two different values in the same effect. An effect expression is a contradiction if converting it to an effect returns the null clause.
      Parameters:
      expression - the contradictory effect
      Returns:
      a FormatException

    • variableMustBeCharacter

      public static final FormatException variableMustBeCharacter(Variable variable)
      Thrown when a variable must of of type character or a supertype of character, generally when defining a mapping function.
      Parameters:
      variable - the variable which needs to be of type character or some supertype of character
      Returns:
      a FormatException

    • utilityMustBePropositionOrNumeric

      public static final FormatException utilityMustBePropositionOrNumeric(Expression expression)
      Thrown when defining a utility function that is neither of type number nor of type boolean.
      Parameters:
      expression - the invalid utility expression
      Returns:
      a FormatException

    • cannotImpose

      public static final IllegalStateException cannotImpose(Expression expression)
      Thrown when an expression cannot be imposed on a state as an effect.
      Parameters:
      expression - the expression which cannot be converted into a valid effect
      Returns:
      an IllegalStateException

    • noExplanationForEmptyPlan

      public static final IllegalArgumentException noExplanationForEmptyPlan()
      Thrown when attempting to add an explanation to an empty plan.
      Returns:
      an IllegalArgumentException

    • noExplanationRequired

      public static final IllegalArgumentException noExplanationRequired(Character character, Action action)
      Thrown when attempting to explain an action which does not require an explanation for a given character.
      Parameters:
      character - the character for whom no explanation is needed
      action - the action that does not need to be explained for that character
      Returns:
      an IllegalArgumentException

    • explanationMustStartWithAction

      public static final IllegalArgumentException explanationMustStartWithAction(Plan<?> explanation, Action action)
      Thrown when attempting to use a plan to explain an action but the plan does not start with that action.
      Parameters:
      explanation - the explanation which does not start with the action
      action - the action
      Returns:
      an IllegalArgumentException

    • noHeuristicGraphNode

      public static final IllegalArgumentException noHeuristicGraphNode(Logical logical)
      Thrown when requesting a node from a heuristic graph that the graph does not define.
      Parameters:
      logical - the expression which has no equivalent node in the heuristic graph
      Returns:
      an IllegalArgumentException

    • utilityNodeAlreadyDefined

      public static final IllegalStateException utilityNodeAlreadyDefined(Character character)
      Thrown when creating a utility node in a heuristic graph for an character who already has a utility node.
      Parameters:
      character - the character who already has a utility node
      Returns:
      an IllegalStateException

    • noSentinel

      public static final IllegalArgumentException noSentinel(Object pattern)
      Thrown when constructing a sentinel pattern for a parser which does not have a sentinel keyword between each pattern.
      Parameters:
      pattern - the pattern followed by another pattern that should be followed by a sentinel
      Returns:
      an IllegalArgumentException

    • noPattern

      public static final ParseException noPattern(String symbol, ImmutableList<Token> tokens)
      Thrown when a parser has been asked to parse a symbol for which no parsing rules are defined.
      Parameters:
      symbol - the symbol for which there are no parsing rules
      tokens - the tokens being parsed
      Returns:
      a ParseException

    • noBuilder

      public static final ParseException noBuilder(String symbol, ImmutableList<Token> tokens)
      Thrown when a parser tries to build an object after successfully parsing it, but no builders are defined that specify how to create the object.
      Parameters:
      symbol - the type of object for where there are no builders
      tokens - the tokens parsed
      Returns:
      a ParseException

    • parseUnexpected

      public static final ParseException parseUnexpected(String unexpected, ImmutableList<Token> tokens)
      Thrown when a parser expected to find nothing but instead found something.
      Parameters:
      unexpected - the thing the parser did not expect to encounter
      tokens - the tokens being parsed
      Returns:
      a ParseException

    • parseUnexpected

      public static final ParseException parseUnexpected(String expected, String unexpected, ImmutableList<Token> tokens)
      Thrown when a parser expected to find something specific next, but something else was found instead.
      Parameters:
      expected - the thing that parser expected to find
      unexpected - the thing the parser found instead
      tokens - the tokens being parsed
      Returns:
      a ParseException

    • parseListCount

      public static final ParseException parseListCount(int count, int min, int max, ImmutableList<Token> tokens)
      Thrown when parsing a list that has the wrong number of elements.
      Parameters:
      count - the number of elements in the list
      min - the minimum number of elements the list should have
      max - the maximum number of elements the list should have
      tokens - the tokens being parsed
      Returns:
      a ParseException

    • noPrinter

      public static final IllegalArgumentException noPrinter(String object)
      Thrown when a printer tries to write an object, but no object printers are defined that accept that kind of object.
      Parameters:
      object - the object which cannot be printed
      Returns:
      an IllegalArgumentException

    • missingCommandLineArgument

      public static final IllegalArgumentException missingCommandLineArgument(String argument)
      Thrown when a set of command line arguments should contain a key but does not.
      Parameters:
      argument - the command line argument that should exist
      Returns:
      an IllegalArgumentException

    • failedToParseCommandLineArgument

      public static final IllegalArgumentException failedToParseCommandLineArgument(String argument, String value)
      Thrown when parsing a value from a set of command line arguments fails. For example, if an argument should be an integer but cannot be parsed as an integer, this exception would be thrown.
      Parameters:
      argument - the key for which the argument is a value
      value - the value following the key
      Returns:
      an IllegalArgumentException

    • fileNotFound

      public static final IllegalArgumentException fileNotFound(String path)
      Thrown when a command line argument is a file, but the file cannot be found.
      Parameters:
      path - the path to the file which does not exist
      Returns:
      an IllegalArgumentException

    • directoryNotFound

      public static final IllegalArgumentException directoryNotFound(String path)
      Thrown when a command line argument is not a directory but should be.
      Parameters:
      path - the path which is not a directory
      Returns:
      an IllegalArgumentException

    • unusedCommandLineArgument

      public static final IllegalArgumentException unusedCommandLineArgument(String argument)
      Thrown when a a command line argument is not used for anything.
      Parameters:
      argument - the unused argument
      Returns:
      an IllegalArgumentException

    • notSet

      public static final IllegalStateException notSet(String name)
      Thrown when an object is null but should not be.
      Parameters:
      name - the name of the thing that is null but should not be
      Returns:
      an IllegalStateException

    • wrongType

      public static final IllegalStateException wrongType(Object object, String type)
      Thrown when an object is expected to be of a certain type but it is not (such as when an illegal cast is about to occur).
      Parameters:
      object - the object that is expected to be of a certain type
      type - the name of the type it should be but is not
      Returns:
      an IllegalStateException
